C1 the act of changing to the next stage of development: Drugs can slow down the progression of the disease. The novel follows the progression of a woman from youth to middle age. She'd always worked with old people so becoming a nurse was a logical/natural progression.

the process of changing or developing towards an improved situation or state: (a) progression toward(s)/to sth The progression towards fairer and more open markets is happening slowly. She spent three years as a senior manager, and from there it was a natural progression to the post of chief executive. The advertisement for the position promises "rapid salary progression." See also
